required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immunogenicity of 9-valent Human Papillomavirus (9vHPV) Vaccine Coadministered With Messenger Ribonucleic Acid (mRNA)-1273 Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) Vaccine (V503-076)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multicenter, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of 2-dose Regimens of 9vHPV and mRNA-1273 SARS-CoV-2 Vaccines Where the First Dose of Each Vaccine Are Given Concomitantly in Adolescents 12 to 14 Years of Age

brief_summary.textblock: The primary hypothesis is that concomitant administration in adolescents of the first doses of 9vHPV vaccine and mRNA-1273 vaccine induces noninferior geometric mean titers (GMTs) of antibodies to each of the 9vHPV vaccine types 4 weeks postdose 2 of 9vHPV vaccine AND noninferior geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) of SARS-CoV-2 spike protein-specific binding antibody at 4 weeks Postdose 2 of mRNA-1273 vaccine, compared with the corresponding postdose 2 GMTs/GMCs induced by a 2-dose regimen of 9vHPV vaccine and mRNA-1273 vaccine, where the first doses of each are administered nonconcomitantly.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titers of Anti-Human Papillomavirus Types 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58
primary_outcome.description: Serum antibodies to human papillomavirus (HPV) types 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58 will be measured with a competitive luminex immunoassay (cLIA). Titers are reported in milli Merck Units/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Concentrations of SARS-CoV-2 Spike Protein-Specific Binding Antibodies
primary_outcome.description: Serum antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 spike protein measured by electrochemiluminescence (ECL)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with at Least 1 Solicited Injection-site Adverse Event
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant, temporally associated with the use of study intervention, whether or not considered related to the study intervention. Solicited AEs are predefined local (at the injection site) for which the participant is specifically questioned, and which are noted by the participant in their vaccine report card (VRC).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with at Least 1 Solicited Systemic AE
primary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant, temporally associated with the use of study intervention, whether or not considered related to the study intervention. Solicited AEs are predefined systemic events for which the participant is specifically questioned, and which are noted by the participant in their VRC.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with at Least 1 Serious Adverse Event
primary_outcome.description: A serious adverse event (SAE) is defined as one that results in death, is life threatening, or requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly or birth defect, or other important medical event that may require medical intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with at Least 1 Vaccine-Related SAE
primary_outcome.description: An SAE is defined as one that results in death, is life threatening, or requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly or birth defect, or other important medical event that may require medical intervention. An SAE that is judged by the investigator to be related to the study vaccine is a vaccine-related SAE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Seroconvert to Each of the 9vHPV Vaccine Types 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52 and 58 Following Administration of a 2-Dose Regimen of 9vHPV Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Serum antibodies to human papillomavirus (HPV) types 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58 will be measured with a competitive luminex immunoassay (cLIA). Percentage of participants who seroconverted will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Experience Seroresponse Following Administration of a 2-Dose Regimen of mRNA-1273 Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Serum antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 spike protein measured by ECL assay. Percentage of participants who experience seroresponse will be assessed.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive their first dose of 9vHPV vaccine and first dose of mRNA-1273 vaccine on Day 1; they will then receive their second dose of mRNA-1273 vaccine at Month 1 and their second dose of 9vHPV vaccine at Month 6.

Participants will receive their first and second doses of mRNA-1273 vaccine on Day 1 and at Month 1, respectively; they will then receive their first and second doses of 9vHPV vaccine at Months 2 and 8, respectively.

intervention.description: 9-valent human papillomavirus (Types 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, 58) administered as a 0.5-mL intramuscular (IM) injection
mRNA-1273 administered as a 0.5-mL IM injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has not yet had coitarche and does not plan on becoming sexually active during the vaccination period
- Participant or participant's legally acceptable representative can read, understand, and complete the electronic vaccination report card (eVRC).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergy to any vaccine component
- History of severe allergic reaction that required medical intervention
- Thrombocytopenia or any coagulation disorder
- Has a history of myocarditis or pericarditis
- Has a history of a clinical or microbiological diagnosis of COVID-19, including a diagnosis of multisystem inflammatory syndrome in children
- Females only: participant is pregnant or expecting to donate eggs during day 1 through month 7
- Currently immunocompromised, or been diagnosed with immunodeficiency
- Had a splenectomy
- Receiving or has received immunosuppressive therapies within the last year
- Received any immunoglobulin product or blood-derived product within 3 months
- Received a marketed HPV vaccine or has participated in an HPV vaccine clinical trial
